FUN AND INTERESTING LINKS

    Videos from the Internet Archive:
    *Internet Access Required

  • Unconditional Surrender (1956)
    National Foundation Infantile Paralysis film which describes the development of the Salk polio vaccine. If you ever wondered who the first kid vaccinated for polio was, you can see him on this film.
  • Immunization (1955) Encyclopedia Britannica
    This film explains, in 1955 vernacular, how vaccines work. Don't try this at home.
  • Lucky Junior (circa 1940s)
  • Babies and Breadwinners, Part I *
    Moscogee County Georgia comes together to encourage mass polio vaccination
  • Babies and Breadwinners, Part II *
    Bozo the Clown rolls up his sleeve to get vaccinated in front of the children of Moscogee County
